title: Field Remedy: 2131
subject:
Engine Z20LE/T/L/R/H, Z16LE/T/L/R -
Whistling noise during deceleration
cause:
Delayed function of the bypass valve of the
turbo charger due to: - wrong mounted vacuum tank from previous
repairs - vacuum tank (below intake manifold): check valve defect,
decrease of vacuum - vacuum pipes (polyamid pipe and hoses)
leaky/defect - switching valve (mounted beside tank) defect -
compressor bypass valve defect

remedyContent.text:
In case of customer complaint check vacuum tank and lines for correct 
mounting. The mark "TOP" on the vacuum tank shows in this application 
downwards. The correct mounting position is important because of the 
check valve inside the vacuum tank. It is possible to check all valves 
and vacuum pipes with a Kent Moore hand pump. If vacuucm doesnÂ´t 
decrease the tested component is OK.

Note: In case of complaint refer also to Quick Information
2259.
